edge: The subject of the film, exodus, is related to Kashmiri Pandits who experienced it between the late 80s and early 90s.
The film was announced with an intent to release it on India's Independence Day in 2020.

node_2: trilogy of 'untold stories of independent india'
edge: Director Agnihotri touted the film as the second instalment of his trilogy, which includes The Tashkent Files and an upcoming The Delhi Files.
As a part of the production, Agnihotri claimed to have interviewed more than 700 emigrants from the exodus over a period of two years.
Actor Anupam Kher joined the cast as the lead actor of the film in December 2019.
The first schedule of the film was called off due to the COVID-19 pandemic in India.
The entire film was shot in 30 days, largely in Mussoorie and Dehradun.
The film was shot at Dal Lake in Kashmir.

node_2: speeches at the 2020–2021 indian farmers' protest
edge: Actor Yograj Singh was removed before the production started in December 2020 due to his speeches at the 2020–2021 Indian farmers' protest.
Puneet Issar was brought in as the replacement for Yograj Singh.
